page.title: 08DOGMERSFIELD VILLAGE
page.content: A conservation area with mix of old and modern houses, church, school, pub, petrol station & car servicing and sales business.No mains drainage, public transport,shop or doctor.It has its own cricket club and Parish Council and joins in with Winchfield Horticultural group and Winchfield & Crookham Village for W.I. It also has a toddler group. Regular events include harvest supper, carol singing and informal gatherings. 1983 census shows population of 351. Approximately 60% of workers commute to London or nearby,some work locally,a few are retired. Very few are truly poor.Older children go on to Calthorpe Park,Fleet to school. There are several farms mostly owned by non-residents.Also several riding stables but no bridle paths. There are many riders on the roads; speed restrictions are wanted.
